content: Thanks for this article, Rahaf! I’ve learned that I’ve always been someone who loves to be part of a tribe. As a community manager I thus focus on creating a tribe. The community I’m responsible for now discusses a highly intimate subject (sexuality) but I’ve witnessed different types of behaviour by members. We have the typical tribe members but also others members who only sign up to ask a question or look at some pictures and then disappear. They usually don’t put as much thought into filling out their profiles as the tribe members do, also their postings are usually much shorter. I struggle to explain to my tribe members why we don’t ban the typical eco-system or single-serving members from participating in our community. I’d love to exchange experiences with other community managers who have had to bridge the same gap between different member types in their communities.
